Hildegard Franke, freshEHR Clinical Informatics Ltd.<hildi@freshehr.com>

details.purpose: For recording the details of the Beighton hypermobility score for quantifying joint laxity and hypermobility.
details.use: To be used to record a the Beighton hypermobility score as one of the criteria in diagnosing benign joint hypermobility syndrome.

items.items: Beighton hypermobility score
The Beighton hypermobility score for quantifying joint laxity and hypermobility.
Event Series
@ internal @
Point in time
A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Tree
@ internal @
Left little finger
Assessment of passive dorsiflexion in the left little (fifth) finger.
Less than or equal to 90 degrees
Passive dorsiflexion in the left little finger is less than or equal to 90 degrees.
Beyond 90 degrees
Passive dorsiflexion in the left little finger is beyond 90 degrees.
Right little finger
Assessment of passive dorsiflexion in the right little (fifth) finger.
Less than or equal to 90 degrees
Passive dorsiflexion in the right little finger is less than or equal to 90 degrees.
Beyond 90 degrees
Passive dorsiflexion in the right little finger is beyond 90 degrees.
Tree
@ internal @
Confounding factors
Narrative record of any issues or factors that may have contributed to the Beighton score.
Tree
@ internal @
Extension
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with HL7 or CDISC equivalents.
Left thumb
Assessment of passive dorsiflexion of the left thumb.
No passive dorsiflexion to flexor
Passive dorsiflexion in left thumb is not observed to be to the flexor aspect of the forearm.
Passive dorsiflexion to flexor
Passive dorsiflexion in left thumb is observed to be to the flexor aspect of the forearm.
Right thumb
Assessment of passive dorsiflexion of the right thumb.
No passive dorsiflexion to flexor
Passive dorsiflexion in right thumb is not observed to be to the flexor aspect of the forearm.
Passive dorsiflexion to flexor
Passive dorsiflexion in right thumb is observed to be to the flexor aspect of the forearm.
Left elbow
Assessment of hyperextension in left elbow.
Less than or equal to 10 degrees
Hyperextension in left elbow is observed to be less than or equal to 10 degrees.
Beyond 10 degrees
Hyperextension in left elbow is observed to be beyond 10 degrees.
Right elbow
Assessment of hyperextension in right elbow.
Less than or equal to 10 degrees
Hyperextension in right elbow is observed to be less than or equal to 10 degrees.
Beyond 10 degrees
Hyperextension in right elbow is observed to be beyond 10 degrees.
Left knee
Assessment of hyperextension in left knee.
Less than or equal to 10 degrees
Hyperextension in left knee is observed to be less than or equal to 10 degrees.
Beyond 10 degrees
Hyperextension in left knee is observed to be beyond 10 degrees.
Right knee
Assessment of hyperextension in right knee.
Trunk
Assessment of forward flexion of trunk with knees fully extended.
Not resting flat
Palms and hands are observed to not rest flat on the floor.
Resting flat
Palms and hands are observed to rest flat on the floor.
Less than or equal to 10 degrees
Hyperextension in right knee is observed to be less than or equal to 10 degrees.
Beyond 10 degrees
Hyperextension in left knee is observed to be beyond 10 degrees.
Total score
Total score of all 9 elements of Beighton test.
Clinical interpretation
Narrative interpretation of assessment.
